Staking.AboutNotReceivedVotingKSP: As this pool has not registered as a FIZZ Mining eligible pool, FIZZ mining will not be distributed to this pool. Users who vote for this pool will share the pool usage fee rewards from this pool.
Staking.AboutPoolVotingSharedMsg5: FIZZ Mining Distribution rates will be determined with a snapshot of the voting status at 9AM (KST) everyday. This rate will be in place until the next round's snapshot. The distributed rewards (APR) are all estimated values. They may differ slightly from the actual values.
Staking.AboutClaimAll: Collect all rewards generated from voted Liquidity Pools
Staking.AboutCompoundReward: You can stake without extending the staked period to get compounded interest.
Staking.AboutCompoundRewardEarned: Yearly reward rate, voting power increase
Staking.AboutCompoundRewardInput: Only FIZZ of whole numbers are deposited, and the rest are deposited to your wallet.
Staking.ShouldDoCompound: Compound your staking to get {amount} addition FIZZ
Staking.CompoundInputMustInteger: You must have at least 1 FIZZ to re-stake.
Staking.DisableNewVotingOnInvalidPool: This pool is not eligible for voting.  You can only unvote.
Staking.AboutRewardTx8Tips: This is the maximum expected annual return on pool usage fee rewards distributed when choosing 8x efficiency staking.
Staking.StakignTotalAprTips:
When staking, FIZZ holders are automatically rewarded with staking and pool usage fee rewards.

Each category's estimated APR is based on the efficiency and on the share of vFIZZ according to the user's staking period. The actual rewards may differ.

＊FIZZ staking expected APR
This is the maximum expected annual return on FIZZ rewards calculated based on the efficiency and on the share of vFIZZ according to the user's staking period.

＊Pool Fee rewards expected APR
This is the maximum expected annual return on Pool Fee rewards calculated based on the efficiency and on the share of vFIZZ according to the user's staking period.
Staking.StakigRewardTxUserTips: This is the maximum expected annual return on pool usage fee rewards calculated based on the efficiency and on the share of vFIZZ according to the user's staking period.
Staking.AboutRewardTooltipnew: Rewards distributed according to the staking APR and pool fee APR can be received in your wallet by 'Claiming'.
Staking.EstimatedStakingAprTips: The APR increases with time, even if you stake the same amount. The estimated APR represents the minimum to maximum annual expected yield calculated based on the vFIZZ at 1x to 8x efficiency staking.
Staking.1dDistributionTips: The sum of staking rewards and pool usage fee rewards distributed daily
Staking.1dStakingRewardTips: FIZZ distributed daily as staking rewards
Staking.1dTxRewardTips: 10% of the Pool fee generated on Fizzswap is bought back with FIZZ, and distributed to vFIZZ holders. Pool fee rewards are based on average buy backs over the previous 7 days.
Staking.StakingBenefits1Tips: Stake FIZZ and receive interest rewards. The APR increases with time, even if you stake the same amount.
Staking.StakingBenefits2Tips: Stakers receive 10% of Fizzswap's transaction (TX) fee profit.
Staking.AboutYearlyTxRewards2: This is the dollar conversion value of the accumulated pool usage fees rewards distributed to Fizzswap users so far.
Staking.VaultStatusKspRewardDetailNew: Single pool {vault}% / Pair pool (V2/V3) {pair}% / FIZZ staking {staking}% / 거버넌스 {governance}%
Staking.HowMiningDistributeItem1New: FIZZ buyback index is used to calculate the distribution ratio.
Staking.HowMiningDistributeItem3New: FIZZ buyback quantity accumulated for 24 hours (9 a.m. every day to 9 a.m. the day after) for each pool gets confirmed as FIZZ buyback quantity per day, and calculate the score by summing the buyback quantities of 1 day (50%), and 7 days (50%). The () parenthesis is the reflection rate of each item.
Staking.CheckVotingAndMiningNoticeNew: Please check out the FIZZ distribution policy on Docs.
Staking.AboutCalculateBuybackNew:
For recently created pairs, FIZZ buyback quantity aggregate criteria would not be met on the 7th due to the short period of pool existing period. In this case, FIZZ buyback quantity aggregated from the creation of the pair to the present would be the norm.
For example, the buyback quantity of a pair that has been created for 3 days is calculated as follows.
1) FIZZ buyback quantity by date
＊Day 1 : 10 FIZZ / Day 2 : 10 FIZZ / Day 3 : 20 FIZZ

2) FIZZ buyback quantity of 1/7 days for the pair
＊1 day FIZZ buyback quantity = 10 FIZZ
＊7 days FIZZ buyback quantity = 40 FIZZ (10+10+20)
Staking.StakignMaxAprTips:
When staking, FIZZ holders are automatically rewarded with staking and pool usage fees rewards.

Each category's estimated APR is based on the maximum efficiency when 8x staking and on the real-time total quantity of vFIZZ. The actual rewards may differ.

＊FIZZ staking expected APR
This is the maximum expected annual return on FIZZ rewards distributed when choosing 8x efficiency staking.

＊Pool usage fees rewards expected APR
This is the maximum expected annual return on pool usage fees rewards distributed when choosing 8x efficiency staking.
Staking.StakingMaxAprTips:
When staking, FIZZ holders are automatically rewarded with staking and pool usage fees rewards.

Staking.NewGoPop: Staking-related transactions can only be available in the New version. Staking participants can continue to receive rewards on the new version without migrating FIZZ.
Staking.8xGuide1: By 8x staking, you gain 8 times the voting rights instead of indefinite lock-up. You can change your staking period back to 12 months (4 times the voting rights) at any time, but unstaking is only possible 12 months after the change.
Staking.8xGuide2: It is not possible to cancel staking before the end of the contractual staking period, so please confirm the end date before staking.
Staking.8xGuide3: Unstaking is possible for 30 days from the end date of the staking contract. If you do not unstake within this period, your contract will automatically renew for the longest period you selected in the previous contract period (4/8/12 months). If indefinite staking was chosen, the contract will automatically renew for 12 months. Automatically re-contracted staking cannot be canceled.
Staking.8xGuide4: During the unstaking period, you retain your voting rights.

Ecopot.AboutStakingEndedDesc: The end date of staking is approaching. If you do not unstake within 30 days from the end date, your FIZZ will be automatically extended for the longest staking period you have contracted before.
Ecopot.StakingExtendWarning1: If you don't want an automatic extension of the staking period, you must proceed with unstaking within the unstakable period or re-extend it to the desired period.
Ecopot.StakingExtendWarning2:
Unstaking is available for 30 days from the end of the staking contract. 
If you do not unstake within that period, longest period (4/8/12 months) among the previous contract periods would be chosen and stakig contract will be automatically renewed according to that period.
Ecopot.StakingExtendWarning3: The renewal of the contract is based on the time of termination of the previous contract.
Ecopot.StakingExtendWarning4: If the contract is automatically renewed after the unstakable period, the contract is irrevocable, so please check the staking end date.
Ecopot.StakingExtendWarning5: Voting rights will still be valid even during the unstaking period.
Ecopot.StakingExtendWarning6: The end date of staking, unstakable period, and the time of re-staking are estimations and may differ from the actual time.
Ecopot.DisableOneDay: Do not show this for a day
Ecopot.AboutSelectStakingPeriod1: The date and time of termination of staking vary depending on the staking extension date and the selected staking period, and unstaking (withdrawal) is possible after the staking end date.
Ecopot.AboutSelectStakingPeriod2: If the existing staking end date <  staking extension date + selected staking period (4/8/12 months), the staking end date will be extended. If the existing staking end date > staking extension date + selected staking period (4/8/12 months), the staking end date would not be change.
Ecopot.AboutTotalRewardsForStaker: The expected return is the sum of staking, drops token, pool usage fee rewards according to the user's current staking efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutStakingEstimated1: In return for staking FIZZ continuously, you can earn FIZZ staking rewards, pool pool usage fee rewards rewards with 8x efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutStakingEstimated2: You can change it to 4 times the staking efficiency at the time you want, and you can unstake (withdraw) after 12 months of lock-up from the time of alteration.
Ecopot.AboutStakingEstimated3: Users can stake FIZZ for 4, 8, and 12 months to earn FIZZ staking rewards, pool usage fee rewards with 1, 2, and 4 times the efficiency, respectively.
Ecopot.AboutStakingEstimated4: It can be changed to 8x staking efficiency at the time you want, and the FIZZ will continue to be staked from the time of change.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip1Item1:
When staking FIZZ, you can receive staking rewards, Drops token rewards, pool voting rewards, and Ecopot rewards. 
The rate of return for each item may differ depending on the user's staking period and the actual distribution of the estimated annual rate of return calculated based on the voting right.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip2Item2: This is the maximum expected annual return on FIZZ rewards calculated based on the efficiency and voting rights obtained according to the user's staking period.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip3Item2: This is the maximum expected annual rate of return calculated based on each Drops reward that has been already distributed in Fizzswap.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip4Item2: This is the maximum expected annual return calculated in consideration of the share of voting rights in the pool in which users actually voted with the voting rights (vFIZZ) obtained according to the user's staking period.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip5Item2: This is the maximum expected annual return calculated in consideration of the share of voting rights distribution in the Ecopot pool in which users actually participated with the voting rights (vFIZZ) obtained according to the user's staking period.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip1Item2:
When staking FIZZ, you can receive staking rewards, Drops token rewards, pool voting rewards, and Ecopot rewards. 
Each item's return may differ from the maximum efficiency of 8x staking and the actual distribution of the estimated annual return calculated based on the total vFIZZ quantity of the real-time protocol.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip2Item3: This is the maximum expected annual return on FIZZ rewards distributed when choosing 8x efficiency staking.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip3Item3: This is the maximum expected annual rate of return calculated based on each Drops rewards distributed in Fizzswap.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip4Item3: This is the maximum annual expected return calculated based on the pool that can obtain the highest return on pool voting with the voting right (vFIZZ) obtained from staking with 8x efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutRewardTooltip5Item3: This is the maximum annual expected return calculated based on the token that can obtain the highest return when participating with the voting right (vFIZZ) obtained from staking with 8x efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutStakingRewardsTitle:
Participate in FIZZ staking and earn
rewards.
Ecopot.AboutStakingRewardsDesc:
FIZZ holders can earn all of the following rewards only by participating in FIZZ staking.
An example is Profit from staking ${number} FIZZ with 8x.
Ecopot.AboutStakingRewardsItem2Text1: Distribute new project tokens to staking participants
Ecopot.AboutStakingRewardsItem3Text1: Distribution of tokens generated from pool usage fee when participating with voting rights obtained from staking.
Ecopot.AboutStakingRewardsItem4Text1: Distribution of tokens to ecosystem partners when participating with voting rights obtained from staking.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyStakingRewards1: It represents the staking reward earnings for a year when staking a ${number} FIZZ with 8x profit efficiency in dollars.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyDropsRewards1: It represents the Drops reward earnings for a year when staking a ${number} FIZZ with 8x profit efficiency in dollars.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyVotingRewards1: It represents the pool usage fee reward earnings for a year when staking a ${number} FIZZ with 8x profit efficiency in dollars.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyEcopotRewards1: It represents the Ecopot reward earnings for a year when staking a ${number} FIZZ with 8x profit efficiency in dollars.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyStakingRewards2: This is the dollar conversion value of the accumulated FIZZ staking rewards distributed to Fizzswap users so far.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyDropsRewards2: This is the dollar conversion value of the accumulated Drops rewards distributed to Fizzswap users so far.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyVotingRewards2: This is the dollar conversion value of the accumulated pool usage fee rewards distributed to Fizzswap users so far.
Ecopot.AboutYearlyEcopotRewards2: This is the dollar conversion value of the accumulated pool usage fee rewards distributed to Fizzswap users so far.
Ecopot.AboutSetMaxMultiplier1: By adjusting the staking efficiency to a maximum of 8x, you can maximize returns from all the rewards.
Ecopot.AboutSetMaxMultiplier2: If you change the efficiency to 8x, the lock-up will continue. It can be changed to 4x efficiency again, and unstaking (withdrawal) is available after 12 months of lock-up from the time of 4x change.
Ecopot.AboutResetMaxMultiplier: Unstaking (Removal) is available after 12 months by adjusting the staking efficiency to 4x
Ecopot.AboutResetUnlimitedLock: If staking FIZZ with 8x efficiency, staking would be continued without any fixed unstaking period. Users who want to end 8x staking should lower the staking efficiency to 4x by clicking the [lower to 4x] button, and you can unstake (withdraw) after locking up for 12 months from that point.
Ecopot.AboutVotingPowerForEcopot: Available for ecopot is the number of voting rights that can currently participate in Ecopot among total voting rights held, separate from available for pool voting.
Ecopot.AboutVotingPowerForPoolVote: Available for pool voting is the number of voting rights that can currently participate in pool voting among total voting rights held, separate from available for ecopot.
Ecopot.EcoPotParticipationImpossible: Pool not able for Ecopot participation, withdrawl only
Ecopot.RemoveAllEcopot_text1: Removeing participation from all Ecopot pool
Ecopot.RemoveAllEcopot_text2: When withdrawing participation, all the rewards distributed so far is automatically received in users' wallet due to changes in balance.
Ecopot.ReceivedRewardEcopot_text: Receiving all rewards distributed from Ecopot
Ecopot.EcoPotModalFirst_explain2:
2) Participating in the Ecopot Pool subject to receive airdrops. 
Unlike Drops that renders automatic participation, users wishing to participate in the Ecopot must directly participate in the desired Ecopot pool, and tokens are distributed based on the number of vFIZZ participated by the user compared to the total number of vFIZZ participating in the Ecopot.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalFirst_explain3:
3) Receive Ecopot rewards by clicking [Receive rewards] button.
Users who participate in the Ecopot can check rewards being distributed in real time and receive distributed rewards at any time. 
If you have participated in multiple projects in the Ecopot, you can receive rewards at once by clicking [Receive all rewards] button.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain1: Users can participate in up to 10 projects with the voting rights (vFIZZ) held on the Ecopot list.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain2:
Users can participate in the Ecopot based on the total amount of voting rights held <strong>, and Ecopot and pool voting are separate votes.
Example) Users with 1,000 vFIZZs can exercise 1,000 vFIZZs in each of the Ecopot and pool voting, respectively.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain3: The expected rate of return represents APR after calculating the annual expected amount of rewards based on the number of vFIZZ participated by the user compared to the total number of total vFIZZ participating in the Ecopot, and it may differ from the actual rate of return.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain4: Ecopot reward distributions are directly executed by each Ecopot project partner and  rewards distribution starts from the start block. You can check the current block number in the top right corner (PC) or side menu (mobile) of the Silicon Scope and Klayswap website.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain5: Distributed Ecopot rewards can be received at any time.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain6: Tokens given as rewards in Ecopot are autonomously issued tokens on the Silicon chain and have not undergone separate screening, ergo stability of the tokens are not guaranteed.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain7:
Projects are voluntarily participating in Ecopot, and Fizzswap does not encourage transactions and investments in the specific token.
Ecopot rewards distribution can be delayed or discontinued because the rewards are distributed to users directly by projects, not by Fizzswap.
Ecopot.EcoPotModalSecond_explain8: Given rewards can be found on [My Assets] page, if not displayed, you can search for the contract address of the token.
Ecopot.AboutDropsClaimableTime1: The distributed Airdrop rewards can be received at once on the [Rewards receivable period] for each token.
Ecopot.AboutDropsClaimableTime2: The [Receive rewards] button is activated on rewards receivable date for each token, and the user must directly click the [Receive rewards] button to receive rewards.
Ecopot.AboutDropsClaimableTime3: The available date for receiving rewards for each token is different and can be changed due to circumstances.
Ecopot.ExplainEcopot: "Available Power of Ecopot" is the number of voting rights that can currently participate in the Ecopot among the total voting rights held, apart from "Available Power of pool voting."
Ecopot.ExplainStakingPool: "Available Power of pool voting" is the number of voting rights that can currently participate in pool voting among the total voting rights, apart from "Available Power of Ecopot."
Ecopot.ReceivedRewardTooltip: When participating/withdrawing participation, the rewards that have been distributed so far is automatically received in the wallet due to changes in balance.
Ecopot.AboutClaimEcopotReward: Receiving distributed rewards without participating in Ecopot. After the transaction is completed, you can check the reward in your wallet.
Ecopot.DisabledBoostByVotingRetract: Currently, there are matters that cannot be withdrawn. You can change it to 4x after the voting withdrawal is completed.
Ecopot.AboutSetMaxMultiplier3: If you change it to 4x efficiency, the user's pool voting and voting rights allocated to Ecopot will be withdrawn due to the change in the number of voting rights. If there is a pool that cannot be withdrawn from voting, you can withdraw the pool vote first and change it to 4x.
Ecopot.AboutVotingRateDowngrade: The expected change in return is the expected return if the user re-votes with the reduced voting right (vFIZZ) after the change in staking efficiency, assuming the current pool distribution ratio does not change. The actual rate of return can vary depending on which pool the user votes for after changing efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutEcopotRateDowngrade: The expected change in return is the expected return when the user re-votes with the reduced voting right (vFIZZ) after the change in staking efficiency, assuming the current Ecopot pool distribution ratio does not change. The actual rate of return can vary depending on which pool the user participates in after changing efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutVotingRateUpgrade: The expected change in return is the expected return if the user additionally votes with the additional right to vote (vFIZZ) after the increase in staking efficiency, assuming the current pool distribution ratio does not change. The actual rate of return can vary depending on which pool the user votes for after changing efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutEcopotRateUpgrade: The expected change in return is the expected return when the user additionally votes with the additional voting rights (vFIZZ) after the increase in staking efficiency, assuming the current Ecopot pool distribution ratio does not change. The actual rate of return can vary depending on which pool the user participates in after changing efficiency.
Ecopot.AboutEstimateAfterParticipation: This is the expected status after participation or withdrawal of participation,and it may differ from the actual value.
Ecopot.SearchEcoPotCondition: Search by projects, tokens, and symbols
Ecopot.CompensationDistributionNotice: Ecopot starts distribution of rewards in {number} block.
Ecopot: • KSP staking is neither an act of entrusting nor entrusting KSP to another person. It is to lock up users' KSP asset by signing so that the KSP is not remitted or traded according to the consented terms agreed by the user themselves (staking period, etc.). Therefore, it is impossible to cancel, withdraw, or change the withdrawal wallet that violates these terms.

Vault.VaultPageTitle: </br>Earn interest earnings by seconds,without asset locked-up restrictions
Vault.AboutRewardsItem1Desc:
Single-asset liquidity provider receive an amount of FIZZ determined by their respective supply share ratio from the amount of daily FIZZ pool distribution. 


15% of the inflation(rewards) before the first halving (2022) is distributed to the development commission, so the rate of return is calculated based on the actual amount of compensation (85%) distributed.
Vault.AboutRewardsItem2Desc: Assets deposited by single pool depositors are utilized as resources for Plus Supply and Long/Short position deposit service, and the costs of utilization paid by borrowers are rewarded back to single pool depositors. The distributed rewards are automatically deposited in your asset balance.
Vault.VaultStatusKspRewardTitle: Daily FIZZ rewards for Single pool
Vault.VaultStatusKspRewardDetail: Single Pool Supply {vault}% / Pair Pool Supply (V2, V3) {pair}% / FIZZ staking {staking}%
Vault.VaultStatusKspAboutHalfLife: Distributing to users after excluding the development commision (15%) until the first halving (2022)
Vault.VaultStatusWarning1: Assets deposited in a single pool accumulate interest earnings according to real-time deposit rate of each pool. Users can freely deposit and withdraw assets at any time.
Vault.VaultStatusWarning2:
Assets deposited in a single pool are utilized for the plus deposit and long/short position deposit, and the borrowers pays the cost (interest) in return for utilizing the single pool asset.

{rewardRate}% of the accumulated interest earnings is redistributed to single pool depositors, and {buybackRate}% of the earnings is used as a fund for FIZZ Buyback & Burn. The more actively single pool assets are used for borrowing, the higher the yield of single pool deposit system.
Vault.VaultStatusWarning3: If a large amount of assets are being utilized in a single pool, your withdrawal request may be temporarily delayed. However, based on the simple law of supply and demand, a single pool asset with hight demand forms high cost (interest) structure, attracting new suppliers and less borrowers. Accordingly, single depositors can withdraw their deposited assets of any size.
Vault.VaultDepositWarning: Your withdrawal request may be temporarily delayed according to the level of pool activation. Please check the detailed instruction before using the deposit service.
Vault.VaultWithdrawWarning: {token} Your withdrawal request is being temporarily delayed due to the high level of single pool activation. You can proceed with the withdrawal by directly entering the amount of token within the current withdrawable range. As the assets currently being utilized are returned, the entire asset withdrawal is possible.
Vault.InsufficientBalanceForWithdraw: You have exceeded the possible withdrawal amount.
Vault.PlusDepositLabel: Use Plus Supply </br> to maximize your yield.
Vault.AboutDetailRewards: This indicates the annual rate of return excluding asset utilization cost of Plus Supply from the total earnings from the Plus Supply service. (if there are two available assets, the asset with lower cost would be the standard according to the rule of utilization) The actual rate of return can differ from the volume of deposited asset, Plus muliplier, and type of asset about to be utilized.
Vault.AboutYearlyUsageCost: This indicates annual interest rates, and actual rate of return depends on the volume of deposited asset, Plus muliplier, and type of asset about to be utilized.
Vault.AboutYearlyAirdropRewards: This is an additional yield rewarded to those providing liquidity to the pool, and will be distributed according to the ratio of pool share.
Vault.AboutAddToCustomRatio: Instead of using the current pool ratio, you can supply desired amounts of assets. Parts of assets supplied this way will automatically be swapped to execute an optimal pair pool supply.
Vault.WantNormalDeposit: Supply pairs without using Plus Supply service
Vault.NeedToCheckUtilizationRatio: Please check the asset utilization rate. (When it exceeds {maxLTV}% asset will automatically be returned.)
Vault.AboutSwapWhenPlusDeposit: A part of the deposited asset, depending on the chosen utilized amount, will be swapped to achieve highest number of LP, then deposited as {pair} pair.
Vault.AboutPlusMultiplierWhenDeposit:
The larger the plus multiplier, the more assets can be utilized, and if the asset utilization ratio exceeds {liquidationRatio}%, the automatic return system activates. Upon automatic return, all of utilized assets would be returned, and the rest of the assets are available for deposit to the user's wallet except for return fee({rate})%.

Vault.PlusDepositGuide2:
About plus settings

 

 

Users can choose how much additional assets they are willing to utilize through the plus multiplier settings. In order to deposit at the scale of (the dollar value of supplying assets*plus multiplier), a certain percentage of the utilized single asset selected by the user is automatically swapped and deposited at the optimal rate. .

If you choose a 3x plus multiplier when supplying 200 USDT, the user will deposit a total of $600 FIZZ+USDT pairs. ($200*3)

 

 

You can choose a plus multiplier from the deposit menu, and in the ‘Estimated Returns’ area, you are able to check your final estimated returns after the completion of deposit.

 

*In the case of 1.0x plus, the amount of assets you are willing to deposit gets deposited as is without single pool utilization.
Vault.PlusDepositGuide3:
About asset utilization

 

 

When using Plus Supply service, the amount of additional asset that users are trying to deposit aside from assets already in their possession is utilized from a single deposit pool, and you can choose which assets to be utilized. If you choose to use USDT when supplying 200 USDT with 3x multiplier, you will utilize 400 USDT from a single deposit pool to achieve an optimal pair deposit, and the user will yield their profit from a total of 15FIZZ+300USDT ($600).

 

 

You can choose an asset to be utilized from the deposit menu, and in the ‘Estimated Returns’ area, you are able to check your final estimated returns after the completion of deposit.
Vault.PlusDepositGuide4:
Asset utilization ratio and auto-return

 

 

Utilization rate refers to the ratio of amount of asset utilized to the total assets deposited. Plus deposit users should always be careful not to exceed 85% of asset utilization for safe asset management. Utilization rate can be affected in the event of volatile price fluctuations of assets, your asset would be auto-returned if the rate exceeds 85%.

To prevent auto-return, you either lower the asset utilization ratio by supplying assets with a low plus multiplier or manually return your asset by withdrawing your asset in withdrawal tap. Upon automatic return, the assets currently being utilized by my assets are returned first, excluding the automatic return fee (20%) from the remaining assets, and the user can directly receive the assets.

The automatic return fee (20%) is used as a safety fund for returning single pool assets that have not yet been returned due to rapid price fluctuations.
Vault.PlusDepositGuide5:
withdrawal and return of deposited asset

 

Users return currently utilized assets first. In case of returning all of utilized assets, they can withdraw the rest and receive in their wallets.

 

 

In the above situation, the user currently has a total of 200 LP Token as evidence deposited in the FIZZ+USDT pool. At this time, 100 LP Token, which is a plus asset, is the quantity required for the user to return the assets currently in use.

If the user withdraws 150 LP Token, 100 LP Token is the quantity needed to return the assets being used on the preferential basis, and the remaining 50 LP Token will be received in the user's wallet. You can check the detailed quantity of LP Token used for return in the returned asset details, and the detailed quantity that can be received in your wallet can be checked in the ‘You get’ history.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused during the service usage.
Thank you.

V3.GnbMenuPairDepositV3Desc: Earn interest by supplying in a specific price range
V3.MigrationPopupV2toV3Sub1Desc:
In contrast to V2 pool, V3 pool enable users to provide liquidity in a specific price range. In the V3 pool, assets are utilized for more swaps, so suppliers can earn more pool usage fees profits and rewards. With the migration function, you can easily transfer assets from the V2 pool to the V3 pool to earn more profit. Please be sure to refer to the Guide for participating V3 Pool and precautions for Migration below.
More about V3 Pool
V3.MigrationPopupV2toV3Sub2Desc: A price range is the range within which you can supply an asset and earn pool usage fee profits. Depending on the current price, depositors can customize the price range for supplies. Users can also supply quickly and conveniently by choosing one of the three price ranges (Spot, Wide, Full range). Currently, pricing information is updated every 10 seconds.
V3.MigrationPopupV2toV3SubImage: What are the characteristics of price ranges?
V3.MigrationPopupV2toV3Sub3Desc:
Supplying in a narrow price range can result in higher trading fee profit, but it may also result in higher impermanent losses because of price fluctuations and frequent migrations may be required.
Notes on price range

Due to the nature of supplying within a specific price range, centralized pairs are subject to risks (E.g., more impermanent losses, need for more frequent migrations).
Precautions for providing liquidity to V3 pools
V3.MigrationPopupV2toV3MigrationDesc: For higher profits, users can simply transfer their deposited assets into a V3 pool in the currently effective price range. Please be sure to refer to the migration precautions below.

SnB.MySnbNetAPYDesc:
Net APY refers to the net interest rate of both supply and borrow assets combined. The net APY can be negative if the borrow APY is greater than the supply APY.

＊Net APY = (Weighted Average Supply APY - Weighted Average Borrow APY) / Net Asset
SnB.MySnbSApyTips: Supply APY is the weighted average of all assets supplied, including incentives.
SnB.CollateralTips: Collateral is the sum of the Max LTV of crypto assets supplied to each liquidity pool. Other crypto assets can borrowed up to the collateral value.
SnB.MLTVtips: Max loan to value(Max LTV) refers to the ratio of assets that can be borrowed to assets supplied to the liquidity pool.If the Max LTV is 80% for USDT and you supply 100 USDT, the amount you can borrow is $80 based on the assets you provided ($100).
SnB.BApyTips: An APY (Supply APY, FIZZ distribution APY) is a real-time fluctuating value based on the pool's total supplied liquidity, supply and borrow status, and the number of FIZZ distributions made per day.
SnB.SnbReserveTips: Reserve is the proportion of costs distributed to the FIZZ buyback reserve from the total borrowing fee. A smart contract automatically distributes 20% of the fees to the FIZZ buyback reserve and 80% to the liquidity pool provider.
SnB.SnbAssetUtilizationRatioTips:
＊Utilization rate(%) = (the borrowed assets/the valuation of the total liquidity provided)＊100(br)
Utilization ratio is the percentage of borrowed assets to the valuation of the total liquidity provided. This results in an automatic return if the baseline utilization ratio is exceeded. Since the utilization ratio can fluctuate rapidly due to a decrease in valuation of the total liquidity provided or a rise in the value of the borrowed assets, the borrower should periodically monitor the utilization ratio to avoid an automatic return.
SnB.SnbAutoreturnFeeTips: When the asset utilization ratio exceeds {threshold}%, the borrower pays this fee to the protocol. After returning the borrow assets, the borrower will receive the remaining amount minus the 20% auto-return fee.
SnB.SnbMainTitle: Supply to earn rewards and borrow assets
SnB.AboutRewardsItem1Desc2: Suppliers receive an amount of FIZZ determined by their respective LP share ratio from the amount of daily FIZZ pool distribution.
SnB.AboutRewardsItem2Desc2: Assets provided by suppliers are utilized as resources for Borrow service, and the borrowing fee paid by borrowers are rewarded back to suppliers. The distributed rewards are automatically included in your asset balance.
SnB.SPopDesc: Removels may be temporarily delayed depending on the level of pool activation. Please ensure to check the relevant policies before supplying liquidity.
SnB.ConnectWalletDesc: Please connect a wallet to view your personal information here.

Widget.SlippagePop3: Increasing slippage can improve the success rate of your trade but may result in losses due to front-running TXs. Lowering slippage can lead to more favorable trades, but the TXs may fail during rapid price fluctuations.
Widget.SlippagePop4: "Min amount" refers to the minimum number of tokens you will receive in a trade based on the slippage you set.
Widget.SlippagePop5: f the tokens you receive are less than the min amount due to slippage, the transaction will be automatically canceled.
